description:
Array processing layer - installer tuning for multi-cabinet systems.

# Processing Layer 2 of 3 Second layer in 3-layer DSP chain: User → **Array** → Preset

# Internal Type Part of `SpeakerOutputChannel`. Path: `/audio/output/speaker/1/array`

# Purpose Installer-level adjustments for array deployment. Used when multiple cabinets work together as a single system (line arrays, subwoofer arrays, delay towers).

# Critical: NO Crossover in Array Layer Unlike preset layer, array processing does NOT include crossover filters. Crossover is only in preset layer (factory speaker voicing).

# Structure - `gain`: Trim gain (-15.0 to +15.0 dB) - `polarity`: Signal polarity (+1 or -1) - `delay`: Array delay (0.0 to 0.02 seconds) - inter-cabinet alignment - `eq`: 5-band parametric equalizer (less than user's 10 bands) - `fir`: FIR filter for array tuning

# Typical Usage - Level balancing between array elements - Time alignment for coherent wavefront - Tilt/splay EQ adjustments - Room/venue acoustic compensation

# Patch Behavior `eq` and `fir` are marked `#[patch(skip)]` - updated via dedicated endpoints, not as complete replacements.

delay.description: Array delay in seconds (range: 0.0 to 0.02) for inter-cabinet alignment

eq.description: 5-band parametric equalizer. Updated via band-specific endpoints.

fir.description: FIR filter for array tuning. Updated via dedicated endpoint.
